title: School Report News Day 2016 as it happened - BBC News
summary: this is school report 's 10th annual news day .
school reporters had to finish their stories by a 14:00 gmt deadline - and get them online by 16:00 .
around 30,000 school reporters at more than 1,000 schools around the uk are taking part today .
a total of just over 100 schools took part in the first news day in 2007 .

documents.title: school report news day 2016 draws to a close
text: well , that 's it .
thanks for reading - and even bigger thanks to the some 30,000 school reporters and teachers in over 1,000 schools who took part in this 10th anniversary year of bbc school report .
it 's been the best yet , with some truly amazing journalism .
thank you for making our 10th birthday such a special day !

documents.title: a news bulletin to be proud of !
text: watch these school reporters giving the professionals a run for their money .

documents.title: sandbach students 'inspired ' by interviews
text: sandbach high school students from cheshire visited wembley arena for their school report project .
they listened to a speech by sohana , who suffers from a rare skin condition making her very sensitive to any contact .
the reporters said they were really inspired after listening to her about the importance of family and staying strong .
they also tackled the topic of whether the uk is gender equal .

documents.title: plymouth weather makes the news
text: school reporters from sir john hunt community sports college in plymouth covered several stories today , such as the asteroid that recently passed by earth .
they also looked at the extreme weather the city has experienced , which damaged the big screen in plymouth 's city centre .
other stories covered were on a young student who has been given a scholarship by arsenal and the progress of plymouth 's new skate park .

documents.title: it 's not just about the news
text: in addition to filing stories to their school websites , many of the 30,000 school reporters have been sharing of what the weather was like in their region .
take a look at some of the images our weather watchers sent in .

documents.title: school reporters learn the ropes from the professionals
text: it has been an epic day of reporting and pupils from schools around the country have been visiting bbc newsrooms across the uk , meeting presenters , journalists and producers who work there .
take a look at how they got on as they learned from the professionals how to make and report the news .

documents.title: school report shout outs !
text: it 's been a busy day for the many schools in the west midlands and warwickshire .
here 's what some have been up to :

at the corbet school technology college in shropshire pupils talked about cry ( cardiac risk in the young ) and interviewed members of staff about the subject of the playground game tag being banned .

the captain of worcester city football club , danny jackman , was interviewed by school reporters at christopher whitehead language college who asked him about the difficulties of relocating the football stadium back into the city .
school reporters at warwick school worked hard filming a whole news programme with stories on the doctor 's strike , floods in the local area and the school 's play gargantua .
sir graham balfour high school reported on a large local fire , the death of sir george martin and the appointment of a new deputy head .
school reporters at st margaret ward catholic academy had an exciting day working on a diverse range of stories from politics to social media .
twelve students reporters from myton school had a great time '' working on stories including random acts of kindness and women in the workplace .

school reporters at charles darwin school in bromley reported on a range of issues from the eu referendum to the junior doctors ' strike and from a new project at their school giving pupils access to brand new instrument to a new cinema opening in orpington .

documents.title: behind the scenes at bbc birmingham news day
text: as roving reporters get ready for school report 's pop-up radio in birmingham , niall,12 , from cardinal newman school in coventry was reporting about what was going on in the bbc birmingham radio studios .

documents.title: zika virus reported on by harrow students
text: rooks heath college in harrow saw 200 students - the whole of year 8 - produce reports on sport relief , top tips for staying safe online , a review of the shakespeare play twelfth night and the effects of the zika virus .

documents.title: is sport just for boys ?
text: school reporters at st alban 's girls school have written a piece entitled is sport just for boys ? ''
they interviewed teachers , who have all competed at high levels in sport , as well as students who compete for the uk .
their report said that while many people still have old-fashioned opinions regarding girls in sport , a culture of innovation is helping to get rid of negative stereotypes .

documents.title: has tim 'peaked ' interest in science ?
text: school reporters from edinburgh academy visited the glasgow science centre , to investigate whether astronaut tim peake 's space mission has led to more people taking an interest in science .
they found out what questions the public asks about space and discovered what the centre is doing to mark tim peake 's achievements .
is @ twitterid inspiring a new wave of science buffs ?
@ twitterid pupils investigate :

documents.title: lancashire students cover mp story
text: bedford high school based in leigh , lancashire , had students working on three different stories today .
one was the tale of a year 11 student who had the opportunity to shadow labour mp andy burnham .
another story was about regenerating a local mill which was last used in the 1970s and another was about a careers fair held last week .

documents.title: wrexham pupils report on all creatures great and small
text: the pupils at st christopher 's school , a special school in wrexham , created reports about their small animal care centre - something they are very proud of .
they also covered a range of other stories about video games , fairtrade fortnight and interpreting british sign language .

documents.title: newcastle pupils produce a multi-lingual bulletin
text: one for the linguists among you @ twitterid # bbcschoolreport pupils give us a multi-lingual welcome !

documents.title: shout outs to top teams of reporters
text: shout out to the pupils at great yarmouth high school who produced a report about black music icons throughout history and their impact on society as well as stories about every day sexism .

meanwhile , school reporters from malet lambert school in hull , st lawrence academy in scunthorpe and sirius academy north in hull prepared questions for their interview with bbc director of radio helen boaden .

documents.title: oxford 's housing poser : refugees or homeless ?
text: school reporter qasem , from the oxford spires academy , has been investigating the link between the homeless in oxford and a need to find housing for refugees .
read the full story .

documents.title: every cloud : school reporter brings us the weather
text: school reporter cansu , from heron hall academy in north london , took over regular weather presenter jay wynne 's lunchtime slot .
watch how she got on .

documents.title: wakefield school reporters interview deaf pupils
text: pupils from castleford academy in wakefield have reported on stories like the school 's year 7 music competition and conducted an interview with deaf students , to find out how they get on with school life .

documents.title: surbiton students interview holocaust survivor
text: girls from tolworth girls school in surrey got the chance to interview rudi oppenheimer , a holocaust survivor , for their school report .
the pupils said they felt `` really lucky and privileged '' to be able to meet him and carry out the exclusive interview .
read the full report here

documents.title: wales rugby star : 'it could be england 's year '
text: former wales international rugby player martyn williams tells school reporters it could be `` england 's year '' in the six nations .
speaking on bbc radio wales to pupils from cowbridge comprehensive , vale of glamorgan , he adds , `` i hope i 'm wrong '' .
listen to the full interview here .

documents.title: students report on work experience
text: pupils from lenzie academy in east dunbartonshire have been hard at work on their school report stories .
these range from the importance of work experience , the affects of cancer and how teenagers view the threat of so-called islamic state .

documents.title: sugar not so sweet ? pupils investigate
text: more than 40 students from arnold hill academy in nottinghamshire have been working on a wide range of stories today .
these include video reports on whether social media is taking over children 's lives , and another on the dangers of sugar .
they are also reporting on a local family who have taken in syrian refugees .

documents.title: behind the scenes on bbc birmingham pop-up radio
text: abdul , 12 , from perrybeaches v and ethan , 13 , from pedmore technology college have been on the bbc school report pop-up radio in birmingham and this is what they had to say .
filmed by pupils from cardinal newman catholic school .

documents.title: pupils ask about new school building
text: fourteen students have been reporting for drayton manor high school in london .
their stories include an interview with the head of building for the school 's new school building , which will house the history and geography departments .
as well as interviews with a fellow student who 's in the junior football development squad for arsenal and another who plays waterpolo .

documents.title: students report on shakespeare performance
text: there have been 38 pupils from appleton academy in bradford reporting on a number of local stories .
these include how the royal shakespeare company is helping to produce a student performance with less able students .
also , they are looking at cancer research and a campaign at the school for teachers to shave their head to raise money for charity .
anti-bullying ambassadors and how students can make a difference in the fight against bullying are also on the news agenda .

documents.title: can meditation improve pupils ' concentration ?
text: iza and leyla , from connaught school for girls , leytonstone , talk about a classroom experiment looking at whether mindfulness meditation can improve pupils ' concentration .
watch their star turn on the bbc news channel here .

documents.title: your of news day 2016
text: we just ca n't get enough of you all .
here 's gallery number 10 for your delectation .

documents.title: shout out to whitley academy
text: miss nguyen from whitleyacademy has headed up her school reporters on their ninth news day , as explained in this bbc blog .
this year 's reporters wish bbc news school report a happy10th birthday .

documents.title: truro tackles heroin story
text: truro high school for girls has reported on a storm that ripped fences from their school and caused havoc earlier in the week and a local art exhibition that opens near them tonight .
they also covered drug use in their county .

documents.title: reporters take part in pop-up radio station
text: school reporters from the west midlands took to the airwaves on a pop-up radio station at bbc birmingham .
pupils from perry beeches v , pedmore technology college , aston manor academy and aldridge school helped broadcast around the uk for two hours .
there were also opportunities to take part in a series of workshops , including learning about how to present the weather and online journalism .

documents.title: pupils hoverboard into news reports
text: sir harry smith community college in cambridgshire had its reporters prepare stories on a range of to today , from stormy weather and baby seals , to the oscars and hoverboards .

documents.title: finns join in
text: as the bbc marked the 10th anniversary of school report , its success could be judged by a similar project in finland .
inspired by the original initiative , national finnish broadcaster yle set up its own media education project three years ago .
students create news content based on themes that are current , relevant and interesting to young people .
hanna visala , a producer on yle news class , said : we started with a pilot project of seven schools - we now have 300 schools , with 9,000 students aged 12 to 16 involved .
we will have our third news day on 26 april , and could n't have imagined how big it would become . ''

documents.title: your
text: spot more of your lovely faces in this new gallery .
enjoy !

documents.title: school reporters analyse the migrant crisis
text: shout out to mascalls academy in kent .
they 've been reporting on the migrant crisis and issues surrounding immigration .
after a lot of hard work and overcoming a last minute technical glitch , they managed to get their bulletin out on deadline .
well done everyone !
watch their news report here .

documents.title: mark mardell faces a grilling from reporters
text: school reporters from haydon school , in hillingdon , grilled radio 4 's world this weekend presenter mark mardell .
he told them about the highs and lows of journalism - and what inspired him to enter the profession to start with .

documents.title: just a minute !
text: how much news can you squeeze into 60 seconds ?
that 's what students from erith school in bexley have been finding out with a visit to the bbc minute studio in london .
on the students ' news agenda was rhino poaching , grumpiness and a cat in a washing-machine .
we think the bbc is one of the most desirable places to work - it looks fun ! ''
summed up student charley .

documents.title: horizon reporters scoop football manager interview
text: horizon community college , in barnsley , managed to bag an interview with barnsley caretaker manager , paul heckingbottom .
nice scoop !

documents.title: cornish students report on pasties
text: students from richard lander school in cornwall have interviewed their local mp about the eu referendum .
they wanted to research if a `` yes '' vote would limit cultural horizons for cornish students .

they have also interviewed local doctors about the strike by some junior doctors , spoken to a girl who has shaved her head to make a wig for a leukaemia sufferer , and interviewed the winner of cornwall 's young author of the year .
they also reported from the world pasty competition .

documents.title: students take charge in moscow
text: something very special happens twice a year at school 1317 in moscow - the students take charge .

watch here as school reporters alexey and natalia explain how their teachers step aside and allow the students to govern the school , helping them to plan and organize lessons and understand the responsibilities that come with being a teacher .

documents.title: boss quizzed over lack of sign language
text: director general tony hall promised to look into increasing the availability of british sign language on entertainment programmes , after he was quizzed by pupils from charlton park academy in south east london .
derren , a deaf student at the special needs academy , told lord hall that insufficient signing on his favourite shows such as casualty and eastenders made them challenging to follow .
derren said he enjoys the programmes but at the moment he has to rely on watching facial expressions to follow the plots .
lord hall said it was a very important point and that he would look into the issue .

documents.title: your
text: more now .
here 's gallery number nine for your enjoyment .

keep a look out for students from frome community college ; wyvern college ; the mountbatten school ; john hanson community school ; longcroft school ; yarrells preparatory school ; east bergholt high school ; hackney new school ; alperton community school ; brentside high school ; elthorne park high school ; drayton manor high school ; all saints academy ; guru nanak sikh academy ; lealands high school ; colchester county high school for girls ; oakgrove school and skinners ' academy .

documents.title: school reporter interviews canadian politician
text: school reporter sarah jane from lady margaret school in london interviewed canadian politician jessica littlewood , which was `` very interesting and fun '' .
students took different roles according to their strengths .
`` some people were shy and did n't want to be on tv a lot , '' said one reporter .
their stories included serious items about the us election and international women 's day , as well as an `` and finally '' piece about the hatching of the school 's chicks in an incubator .

documents.title: reporters have a 'fun time ' coding
text: school reporters from st cuthbert 's catholic high school in st helens , are in salford at the cutting edge of technology , learning to write computer code with the help of a micro : bit .
they said they were `` surprised at how [ much ] fun it turned out to be . ''

documents.title: school 's out for camden head teacher
text: school reporters from regent high school in camden , london have been looking at the impact of gcses on students , what the school is doing for the environment , and - most importantly - an interview with the head teacher , who is leaving the school soon .

documents.title: how to make a million by vlogging
text: pupils from wrenn academy in wellingborough , northamptonshire turned the camera on themselves to investigate the world of youtube influencers .
@ wrennacademy pupils report on a very modern form of storytelling : # bbcschoolreport # vlog

documents.title: what would students teach the teachers ?
text: school reporters at impington village college in cambridge , archbishop tenison 's ce high school in croydon , and london based john roan school and blackheath high school suggested the lessons they would teach if teachers sat at desks in schools instead of them .
guess what ?
the lessons would have nothing to do with english , maths or science !

documents.title: shout out to heart of england school
text: pupils from heart of england school have taken part in their first news day , reporting on local flooding , changes to the english language and the debate team focused on the motion america could be great again with donald trump . ''
grace says : `` it has been a challenging but engaging experience to take part in our first school report .
great fun ! ''

documents.title: world at one finds out what children want to know about brexit
text: what children want to know about brexit # wato

documents.title: school reporters learn technical skills
text: a top tip when filming on your phone camera - zoom with your feet ( physically move up to the object rather than pressing buttons on the camera ) .
this comes courtesy of school reporters sherona and marijudy , from st mary 's catholic high school in croydon , who have been learning radio and television technical skills .
read more about tips they up here .

documents.title: reporters quiz the bbc 's mark mardell on most awkward moment
text: school reporters berdan and sudnaz , from heron hall academy , enfield , went behind the scenes at bbc radio 4 's the world at one and asked presenter mark mardell to reveal his most awkward moment .
clue : it 's script-related .
find out more here .

documents.title: visiting bbc scotland for school report
text: pupils from bellahouston academy have been interviewing bbc scotland news presenter sally mcnair and finding out what it took to become a top journalist .
pupils from st andrew 's and st bride 's school in east kilbride also quizzed sports producer marion macneil for school report .

documents.title: manchester schools get behind the scenes at media city
text: the bbc in manchester has been giving students behind-the-scenes access to all of its programmes and letting them have the chance to try presenting and producing some of them too .

documents.title: music while you work ?
text: school reporters from chislehurst and sidcup grammar school in bexley have been working on stories about footballers ' wages , sugar in drinks , virtual reality , and the pros and cons of listening to music while working .

documents.title: 'a world of good '
text: school reporters at redwood secondary school in rochdale , lancashire , have been `` trying their very best '' , with reports on the oscars and the weather , said their teacher .
some 30 students with learning disabilities , from years seven to 11 took part .
`` in terms of confidence , it does them a world of good .
it 's a chance to express themselves . ''
they struggled quite a bit but it was `` a great experience , '' said the teacher .

documents.title: special report on hamburg migrants
text: hamburg now has 39,000 refugees living in and around the city , and the german government expects that figure to double by the end of this year .
the influx of people is the topic of conversation in the city , and one which is followed by all ages .
this year we have a special documentary on the world service made by the students of helene-lange gymnasium , a bi-lingual secondary school , in hamburg .
in it , school reporter cathleen , who is 15 , takes us on a tour of hamburg to meet politicians , townspeople and the new migrants as they make that city their home .

documents.title: school reporters triumph over network problems
text: school reporters at the red maids ' school in bristol met their deadlines , despite a network problem during the morning which briefly meant they were unable to upload their videos .
students said they had a great day , covering stories including the baby gorilla born by caesarian section , donald trump 's us election campaign and women 's football .

documents.title: pupils get to grips with body issues
text: astley cooper school in hertfordshire has had a group of school reporters working hard on their stories , with the help of media teacher mr aucock and bbc digital video mentor claudia redmond - seen on the left here .
the stories they 've looked at include ones on body image and the issue of people with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder , commonly known as adhd .

documents.title: keeping to a tight deadline
text: school reporters at rishworth preparatory school at sowerby bridge in yorkshire have been learning about deadlines .
`` at the start of the day they feel like they have a lot of time but they do n't realise how much editing there is to do , '' said their teacher .
school reporter nick said the experience had helped him with teamwork , `` learning to work with each other '' .
he said he had also up technical skills , like lighting and filming , as well as the best questions to ask interviewees .
fellow reporter abbie added : `` i 've just really enjoyed the day and learned a lot about editing . ''

documents.title: school reporters discuss eu on world at one
text: there 's been a lot of eu referendum talk today .
here school reporters from dyce academy in aberdeen tackle the thorny subject on bbc radio 4 's world at one .

documents.title: pupils look at driverless cars and climate change
text: the laurels school in clapham , london has seen its years seven , eight and nine pupils working hard to finish articles on such subjects as diversity in the media , sport for girls , driverless cars , wearable technologies and climate change .

documents.title: students go gaga over seal pups
text: grangepark school in wrotham , kent looked into such stories as seal pups in the local area , the fifth anniversary of the fukushima disaster and lady gaga 's charity auction .
fifteen school reporters from years nine and 10 took part , under the tutelage of first-time school report teacher , matthew peacock .

documents.title: life as a migrant in germany 's hamburg
text: some 39,000 refugees live in hamburg , germany .
radio 1 's newsbeat asks 15-year-old fleming , from a school in the city , to find out more about the experiences of being a migrant there .
listen to how he gets on here .

documents.title: bristol school reporters look at grade changes
text: school reporters from john cabot academy in bristol decided to cover to such as mental health , the recession , grades changing from letters to numbers , and us republican presidential hopeful donald trump .

documents.title: pupils in northern ireland get baking
text: heritage food is on the menu in northern ireland , so school reporters have been busy looking at traditional methods of baking , which are proving very popular .
it 's all part of a special school report programme which was broadcast on the red button today .
who can resist some traditionally made butter , made from the milk of grass-fed cows , or soda bread made by hand , for example ?
school reporters from assumption grammar school rolled up their sleeves and got stuck in to find out .

documents.title: your news day in
text: now for more of your lovely faces in our latest gallery .
click here to see if you and your classmates have made it in .

documents.title: homework heaven or homework hell ?
text: students from the london oratory school have been investigating the world of virtual classrooms , or 'cloud computing ' .
this could potentially reduce reasons for not submitting homework , such as printing problems or broken usb cables .
kamil , 14 , said : `` printers are always low on ink , lots of people do n't always have access to them and they are very costly to use regularly . ''
luke , 13 , saw some possible downsides , however : `` not all pupils have access to the internet and wo n't want people to know that they can not afford the latest tech . ''
maurice , 13 , added : `` schools will have to cater for everyone so that all pupils can access the software . ''

documents.title: weather outlook fine
text: jack , a pupil at the westminster school , in the west midlands , visited the bbc midlands studio and had the opportunity to go behind the scenes and host a mock weather report .
he also produced a news report analysing the chart show .
he said it was `` good fun '' and even managed to quiz radio 1 chart show presenter greg james to add to his piece .

documents.title: reporters explain their meditation experiment
text: iza and leyla from connaught school for girls in leytonstone , east london went live on the bbc news channel with simon mccoy and jane hill to talk about their school report meditation experiment .
other reporters at the school also put together stories - on to around international women 's day .

documents.title: historic bristol schools set to merge
text: redmaids ' school and redland high school , two of the oldest girls ' school in england are set to merge - and school reporters olivia , connie and christina had the inside track .
read the full story here .

documents.title: edinburgh academy interviews sports stars
text: the edinburgh academy has covered a wide range of stories this year for school report .
its pupils have interviewed scottish rugby legend mike blair and the minister for transport , derek mackay msp .
pupils interviewed fellow student ben , who received his first football cap for the scotland under 18s last week , and their head of hockey , mr duncan , who is now a scotland international player .

documents.title: reporters head to olympic park in stratford
text: school reporters from roding valley high school in loughton , essex headed to stratford , east london , to find out what the olympic legacy has meant for local residents .
questions asked included : how has stratford perceptibly changed since the olympic games ? ''
and what is your opinion of stratford now ?
they said : `` our report shows how the regeneration of stratford has had a positive influence on the surrounding areas and on stratford itself . ''

documents.title: denzil - the dog helping pupils to read
text: denzil the dog has been helping less confident readers at cirencester deer park school in gloucestershire get to grips with books .
his favourite place is the school library .
school reporters find out more here .

documents.title: youtube policy reported on by students
text: students from skinners ' academy in hackney , london have worked on a number of stories for their school report .
these included : global warming , do teenagers get enough sleep and whether youtube should have a restriction policy .

documents.title: former footballer fabrice muamba interviewed
text: school reporters in birmingham have been chatting to former footballer fabrice muamba , who suffered a cardiac arrest when playing for bolton wanderers .
his heart stopped for 78 minutes .
fabrice told students about the moment he collapsed and the time he was told he would never play football again .
he also shared his best moment when playing for birmingham city , earlier in his career , and his current role with the football association .

documents.title: derry students tackle local stories
text: students from across four derry grammar schools have come together to write a series of stories .

the 28 school reporters tackled stories as northern ireland assembly elections , a major lego exhibition coming to derry , the rise of american football in northern ireland and derry 's bid to become european youth capital .
the world 's oldest department store , austin 's , situated in the city , is closing after 150 years , and students also gauged reaction in the city centre .

documents.title: supersonic story
text: the heathland school , in hounslow , west london is reporting on the bloodhound engineering project to build a supersonic car .
the bloodhound team says its vehicle will be able to cover a mile in just 3.6 seconds .
the students said they had no trouble hitting their deadline as they are used to working together to very tight deadlines .

documents.title: lessons in 'driving the desk '
text: watch reporters from lowton school , wigan , expand their media training and learn the secrets of `` driving the desk '' at bbc radio manchester .

documents.title: bring me sunshine : students present the weather
text: presenter sarah keith-lucas gave a group of students from heron hall academy in edmonton , north london , the chance to find out what it 's like to be a weather presenter .
watch how they got on here .

documents.title: students visit jaguar engine centre
text: seventeen year nine students from maple hayes dyslexia school , lichfield , visited the jaguar land rover engine manufacturing centre , wolverhampton .
the state-of-the-art advanced engine facility , which has created 1,400 new jobs , was officially opened by the queen in october 2014 .
the students toured the plant , then split into groups and interviewed staff .

documents.title: on the wall
text: pupils at sleaton sluice middle school in whitley bay , have done a piece about the building of hadrian 's wall , built by the romans to defend the northernmost part of their empire .
they interviewed an architect who came in to tell them about the history of the wall .
`` the students loved it , '' said a teacher .

documents.title: it 's 4 o'clock !
text: have you uploaded all your stories to your school report website ?
16:00 gmt is the deadline !

documents.title: have you made our gallery ?
text: if you 've not spotted your face on our live page yet , see if you 've made it into our latest gallery , especially school reporters from lady margaret school in west london ; farringdon community academy in sunderland ; the billericay school in essex and christ the king college on the isle of wight .

documents.title: hawick pupils report on eu referendum
text: hawick high school in the scottish borders has reported on the eu referendum as its top story .
some of its other stories include energy pricing , the junior doctors ' strike and the floods of december 2015 , along with some other local stories .
the pupils have filmed everything and are currently in the process of editing their reports together .

documents.title: crunch time
text: `` it 's crunch time , '' said a teacher at royal wootton bassett academy .
students have spent weeks filming , interviewing , writing and editing pieces on subjects as varied as whether tackling should be banned in school rugby and the eu referendum .
`` they absolutely loved it .
now they are pulling everything together .
`` i think they will rise to the challenge , '' they said .

documents.title: pollution report live from delhi
text: priya and ayush impressed earlier on the bbc news channel , in an interview from delhi via a live link-up , to tell the uk about the highs and lows of making their report on pollution .

documents.title: can mindfulness help pupils ' concentration ?
text: a group of bbc school reporters from connaught school for girls in leytonstone , east london , decided to investigate whether mindfulness meditation can help them concentrate ?
but there some concerns about the practice .
two of the girls , iza and leyla , are appearing live on the bbc news channel shortly .

documents.title: vlogging : how to make a million pounds !
text: school reporters from wrenn academy , wellingborough explore how youtubers have made their fortunes by vlogging .

documents.title: barclay reporters ask whether mobiles are keeping us awake
text: another update on the hot to of the day :
school reporters at the barclay school , stevenage , are asking : `` are our mobiles keeping us awake ? ''
and have been speaking out about excess violence in video games .
they 've also considered whether gcses are getting harder and the chances of a landing on mars .
over at rushcliffe school , nottingham , things are getting political .
school reporters are covering everything from the junior doctors ' strike to changing the a-level curriculum and discussing the eu referendum .
they 've also interviewed their two own olympic gymnasts .

documents.title: greenacre tackles anxiety , the eu vote and sugar
text: lily , charlotte and georgia , from greenacre school for girls , sutton , discussed their news reports on sugar and young people 's involvement in the eu referendum live on bbc radio surrey .
meanwhile , maddie , phoebe and elize addressed the thorny issue of anxiety among teenage girls in a video report , which you can watch here .

documents.title: madness at school report
text: students at william ellis school in london , who filed reports from bbc hq earlier , have been given a special shout-out by a former pupil and one part of the band madness .
mark 'bedders ' bedford is guitarist with the group , famous for a string of hits including house of fun , it must be love and baggy trousers .
oh what fun we had

great work everyone .

documents.title: birmingham news day : behind the scenes
text: anais and cassie , from cardinal newman catholic school , talked to gabrielle , from aldridge school who said she was excited and nervous '' to be presenting news on the show .

documents.title: sport news masterclass
text: school reporters adam , samuel , raees and rio from norden high school and sports college in blackburn were given a masterclass in presenting by sport news presenter olly foster at the bbc sport centre in salford .

documents.title: the icing on lyndon 's cake
text: year 7 students , yvonne and roshane , from lyndon school in solihull have written this special report after bringing a fabulous cake - on two trains - to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the bbc school report .
`` a homemade cake from lyndon school was brought to london by the students in time for director-general tony hall to cut it .
it was specially made by the school for bbc 's school report 's anniversary .
`` the lyndon students were able to talk to mr hall before the cake was cut . ''
`` he told us that people do n't bring him cake very often , ' said roshane .
`` he also said his job was very busy ! ''

documents.title: just a minute
text: pupils from the holt school , wokingham , spent a few hours at bbc broadcasting house , london .
they learned how to prepare and present the news stories involved in a bbc minute , which is a news bulletin updated every half-hour 24/7 .

documents.title: pupils report live on bbc radio surrey
text: pupils lily , charlotte and georgia , from greenacre school in banstead , were invited into bbc radio surrey this morning to talk live on air about their school reporting .
they discussed their reports on sugar and the involvement of young people in the eu referendum .
fellow reporters maddie , phoebe and elize were also busy in school working on stories about anxiety issues in teenage girls .
check out the results of all their hard work here - it 's all looking very impressive .

documents.title: kickboxing champion covered by school report
text: ellie , a pupil at limavady grammar school in county londonderry , is the world kickboxing union championship under-12 world champion .
fellow pupils - and school reporters - sorcha and bobbi decided to write about her achievement .

documents.title: birmingham news day : behind the scenes at bbc midlands todayby anais and cassie from cardinal newman catholic school
text: `` rebecca wood , weather presenter for midlands today , gave us a sneak peek into the secrets of the newsroom .
`` the room seemed a lot smaller than it looks on our tvs at home .
this is because of the wide screen effects and black curtains which gave it the effect of a never-ending set . ''

documents.title: sport relief fundraising tops the news agenda in kent
text: it 's not just writing and filming that has kept school reporters busy at sir joseph williamson maths school in rochester , kent .
they are also one of the top sport relief fundraisers , so their main story is focused on their efforts over the past year .
school reporters also went to the gsk human performance research centre on tuesday to interview paralympic medalist david weir .

documents.title: manchester pupils go live on the radio
text: students from our lady 's rc high school in manchester got stuck into the newspapers and selected stories for the lunchtimers slot on justin moorhouse 's radio manchester show .
they also interviewed station dj mike sweeney about his life and career .

documents.title: listen : young carer tells her story to bbc woman 's hour
text: shantavia from la retraite school in lambeth , south london reported on her life as a young carer to her mum and sisters on bbc radio 4 's woman 's hour this morning .
and there was a lot positive reaction to her story on social media .
if you missed her report you can listen to it again here
the teenage girl who is a carer , just now on @ twitterid amazing , funny and inspirational .
what a girl .
the young carer talking about her life on @ twitterid is an inspiration , as well as sounding like just a lovely young woman .
well done !
really lovely to hear such a rounded perspective of being a young carer on @ twitterid lots of highs as well as lows .

documents.title: division of labour
text: students at bury st edmunds county upper school in suffolk divided up tasks according to .
their strengths , said teacher sally phillips .
`` they worked out what their strengths were .
`` some were good at drama so they interviewed people .
`` some were good at english so they worked as editors . ''

documents.title: keeping out of trouble at oriel
text: today 's top stories from oriel high school in west sussex include the twin to of flood damage and trouble makers .
the team of 24 students has been debating how the local community coped with recent floods and how mischief-makers are affecting the reputations of thousands of good students !

documents.title: fair cop for kent pupils
text: longfield academy , kent has had 18 reporters from years seven to nine working on stories today .
anna has looked at how the police catch criminals and had the advantage of interviewing one of her teachers , who used to be a detective before changing careers .
no getting way with forgetting your homework there .
fearne has been looking into how alzheimer 's and dementia affect individuals and says it 's 'been interesting learning all about emotions '' .

documents.title: name your favourite shower song ?
text: adelio and bolu , two pupils from st andrews and st brides high school , interviewed bbc scotland sports producer marion macneil about her reporting experiences and travels to exciting places .
schoolmates beth , corinna and carleen appeared on the kaye adams show earlier on bbc radio scotland .
they talked about their report into the migrant situation , and were put on the spot with a question about their shower song .
their answer ?
kate bush 's wuthering heights .
we like that too !

documents.title: from segways to ghana
text: four main areas have been researched by students at south craven school in cross hills , north yorkshire .
they told school reporters rudo and sevim , from lealands school in luton , that they were looking into personal transporters , peer pressure , education and ghana .
sevim said : `` they are a partner school and found out how education and rules are different in ghana . ''
rudo added : `` i enjoyed calling everybody , because i 'm a chatty person and it was good to come to the bbc and find out more about the different career options . ''

documents.title: radio 1 's clara amfo joins at school report
text: radio 1 presenter clara amfo headed straight to the school report newsroom after her show .
she joined the team of reporters calling schools for updates .
`` confidence is such an important thing - not all of the students were happy to make phone calls to start with but they all got into it , '' said clara .
`` it was really great to see their confidence going from zero to 100 in a few minutes . ''

documents.title: year 7 students become reporters on merseyside
text: hope academy , merseyside has a dedicated group of year 7 students working as reporters today .

documents.title: report on funding for young carers

documents.title: term time holidays
text: term-time holidays are a big issue for students at solway community college in wigton , cumbria .
year 10 students worked in teams of four to produce reports on parents being fined for taking their children on holiday in term-time .
the reporters were not frightened of tackling other controversial issues , with pieces on extreme weather and the cost of women 's sanitary products .

documents.title: school reporters ask about syria

they travelled to the department for international development in whitehall , to talk to secretary of state for international development justine greening .

text: simon james , head teacher of denbigh school in luton said school report news day had created quite a buzz .
`` it 's quite exciting , '' said mr james .
highlights of the students ' reporting included an interview with a member of staff who was a police officer before training as a teacher .

documents.title: the europe question
text: colchester county high school students have been gathering views from their classmates on whether the uk should leave the european union .
the team of 10 students from year seven have also produced a report on the use of stem cells in medicine .

documents.title: winston churchill school students to guest-edit tv news
text: running orders to sort .
thomas and yasmin from the winston churchill school in woking are guest editing the bbc news channel today .
here they are in an editorial meeting in the london newsroom , working through story ideas .

documents.title: what is homework for ?
text: school reporters at bridgewater school in warrington , cheshire carried out a survey of year eight students about homework and whether pupils think it is useful .
the reporters said they had really enjoyed taking part in school report and had a lot of fun .

documents.title: students chat to carol kirkwood
text: elizabeth and marta from lilian baylis technology school in south london have been calling schools with the help of bbc weather presenter carol kirkwood .
the students also took the opportunity to interview carol .
`` carol has been working at the bbc for 20 years and loves the fact that she gets to go on location , '' elizabeth and marta report .
`` she says the best thing about her job is that every day is a new day . ''

documents.title: smiley face
text: pupils from castle school in pembrokeshire are looking at transgender awareness , the ever-growing popularity of emojis and a voluntary smoking ban at little haven , a local beach .
the students are also reporting on the increase of children taking anti-depressants , and a visit of naked choir winners to the school .

documents.title: pupils investigate cancer treatments
text: the school report team at whalley range high school in manchester have been finding out everything they can about cancer .
this year , a number of celebrities succumbed to the disease including david bowie and terry wogan .
check out their fantastic in-depth video report on their school 's special report page .

documents.title: in school reporters start gathering the news
text: in addition to filing stories to their school websites , school reporters have been sharing of their hard work .
check out the first gallery of the day here .

documents.title: liverpool school looks at everton tickets
text: the de la salle academy in liverpool is looking at a local story , examining the reduction in season ticket prices at everton .

school reporters also reporting on the visit of a holocaust survivor to the academy for holocaust memorial day , why attendance is important for students and whether tackling should be banned in school rugby .

documents.title: ghosts , black friday sales and social media
text: a quick update on some of the subjects under scrutiny by school reporters on this 10th news day .
hamilton college in hamilton is working on a report about their school entering a reading competition , while brave elgin high students are interviewing pupils and parents who believe in ghosts .
williamwood high in clarkston is investigating the influence of social media on young people .
black friday sales are the focus of reports from dunoon grammar and west calder high school school reporters are reporting on a memorial football match .
we 're looking forward to seeing your reports , newshounds !

documents.title: students prepare for school report
text: year 7 pupils at saint john wall catholic school in birmingham are seen here preparing for their busy day ahead as school reporters .

documents.title: deadline stress at cricket green
text: a big newsroom at cricket green school in mitcham where 80 year 10 students have been reporting on the us election and films .
the students report they are loving the day so far but reaching the deadline is stressful .
sounds like more biscuits and squash are needed

documents.title: teachers shout out
text: if stress is rising in the newsroom and you need some words of encouragement then look no further !
check out the school report shout outs page where you can find messages of support and congratulations from your schools and teachers .
see if you can find your school 's shout out here
and here 's one from us keep up the great work school reporters , you 're doing a fabulous job !

documents.title: esher high students gear up for editorial meeting
text: students at esher high school are in the thick of it , preparing for an editorial meeting with their first interview about an arts commission at sandown park racecourse .

documents.title: health issues under scrutiny
text: heyford park free school in oxfordshire is reporting on health issues .
its pupils are looking at whether low fat means higher sugar , whether contact rugby should be banned in schools and on a portable toothbrush/toothpaste invention created by an entrepreneur student .
good luck everyone !

documents.title: eerie echo for marden reporters
text: students from marden high school in tyneside want to give a shout out to teachers miss long and mr ranson for organizing the school report activities , which included discussions on instagram and champions league football .
amy , a pupil at the school , told our student reporters at new broadcasting house that the funniest thing about the day was repeating questions because of an echo in the room .
spooky !

documents.title: watch : school reporters go live
text: did you know you can listen to and watch a host of school reporters from across the uk from this live page ?
right now you can hear from the pupils joining jason mohamed on radio wales , coming in from bbc cardiff .
you can also listen to the asian network , who are broadcasting until 13:00 gmt from a school in bradford .
at 12:00 gmt there will be a video live stream from the school report pop-up radio station at bbc birmingham .
then this afternoon from 14:00 gmt there 'll be a news bulletin broadcast from new broadcasting house in london followed by live video from bbc belfast from 14:30 gmt .
just click on the live coverage tab at the top of this page .
pupils from year 9 @ twitterid are in charge today @ twitterid with @ twitterid good luck to them !

documents.title: covering news , entertainment and sportstudents report on eu referendum , school plays and sports
text: pupils at riddlesdown collegiate in croydon are covering a range of issues .
they are debating the eu referendum , have coverage of last month 's oscars ceremony and a report on the school 's recent production of pirates of penzance .
in sport , the students will feature chelsea 's exit from the champions league and the story of tennis player maria sharapova 's positive drugs test .

documents.title: nervy , interesting and enjoyable
text: what 's it like for our school reporters to be chasing updates and finding stories for news day ?
students from st marylebone school in london have been at the sharp end , making phone calls and writing reports .
elle , 12 , said : `` it 's quite stressful at first trying to contact people on the phone , but it 's interesting to find out what other schools are researching . ''
joyce , 13 , added : `` i was quite nervous but then called my own school and got much more into it .
it was really good to find out what other schools are doing . ''

documents.title: scotland 'shoud stay in '
text: the uk should stay in the eu , scotland 's minister for europe and international development humza yousaf msp has told reporters from edinburgh academy .
while he said the eu was not perfect , he thought the country would be stronger in than out of europe - with serious economic , political and constitutional implications involved in leaving .
pupils charlie , harriet , innes , cameron , gabriella , natalie and rohith were the reporters tackling the big issues .
fellow pupils plan a video report for the end of the day .

documents.title: tackling the tough questionsinterviewing a rugby great on radio wales
text: pupils from cowbridge comprehensive have been interviewing ex-wales rugby player martyn williams , whose daughter goes to the school .
what does he think of early-morning training ?
does he agree that tackling should be banned in school rugby ?
and , of course , who is going to win on saturday in the six nations ?
top questions , school reporters alice , adam , jack , livvy and eve !

documents.title: asian network 's nihal faces some 'insightful questions '
text: great speaking to the students here in bradford for @ twitterid they are asking some really insightful questions .
@ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid i grew up on the edge of manningham , bradford my home town .
huge talent in bradford .
needs support .

documents.title: rugby reports from amery hill
text: year 9 and 10 students at amery hill school in alton have been busy conducting interviews at their school .
those to face the microphone include the girls and boys ' rugby teams and a local author .

documents.title: let them eat cake
text: pupils from lyndon secondary school in solihull have brought a special school report cake to bbc broadcasting house in london .
it looks too good to eat !
we have arrived and children and cake are in tact # bbcschoolreport @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid wow !
amazing cakes !
so that 's how to 'sweet ' talk news reporters !
@ twitterid @ twitterid shameless promotion of the @ twitterid to children .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid do you like the bbc ?
yes ?
have a cake .
@ twitterid yum yum

documents.title: dixons students give the lowdown on exam stress
text: how big an issue is exam stress ?
students at dixons city academy in bradford talk to bbc asian network presenter nihal on how they prepare for their exams .
and they 're chatting all morning until 13:00 gmt on bbc asian network @ twitterid - so do n't miss a minute .

documents.title: thrill
text: pupils from cardinal newman catholic school in coventry have joined bbc birmingham school report news day as part of the communications team .
kieran , 13 , said : `` i 'm really excited .
`` i 've been waiting for a month to come to the bbc .
when you think it ca n't get any better , it does ! ''

documents.title: going live : our lady 's rc high school in the gallery
text: students from our lady 's rc high school in manchester watch work taking place in the gallery , as bbc breakfast goes out live on air .

documents.title: newsroom democracy
text: a really brilliant idea at castle school in kilgetty where students decided on which role they would fill on school report news day by discussing their strongest points , which helped them assign roles .
`` it was a good experience and we had a good time , '' the pupils told our reporters from st marylebone school in the collaboration zone at new broadcasting house .

documents.title: st cuthbert 's students give bbc breakfast presenters a grilling
text: there 's been great excitement among 12 lucky students from st cuthbert 's catholic high school in st helens , who are visiting the bbc 's studios in salford .
they had some tough questions lined up for the breakfast presenters : `` so , charlie , i understand you used to work in a bar .
how did you then become a bbc breakfast presenter ? ''
we do n't envy you , charlie !

documents.title: doctors and teenagers
text: junior doctors on strike and whether children receive enough sleep are two to being investigated by failsworth school in oldham , greater manchester .
fifteen children are taking part and will be compiling a video report , teacher claire reedy told reporters max and sid from william ellis school in north london .

documents.title: live on the asian networkare pupils too stressed ?
text: at dixons city academy in bradford school pupils are talking about the stress of exams .
they think they are tested too much .
some say exams are scary - others say that there is too much pressure to get good grades .
what do you think ?
let us know @ twitterid

documents.title: climbing new heights at northfield academy in aberdeen
text: climbing new heights at northfield academy in aberdeen

documents.title: breakingwelsh celebrations at cynffig
text: lots happening at cynffig comprehensive in bridgend , where year 8 and 9 students have been reporting on cyber bullying , street art and school dinners .
they are also celebrating welsh culture .

documents.title: getting involved in the referendum
text: the eu referendum is on the agenda at durham high school for girls .
teacher rebecca told school reporters from william ellis school in london that they chose the subject as it was important for the students and could affect them in the future .

documents.title: kicking off in burton
text: reporters from william ellis school in camden are working in the school report collaboration zone at new broadcasting house they have been talking to abbot beyne school school-reporters in burton-on-trent .
- who have been super-busy interviewing the community fire service , the school council and burton albion f.c .
footballers .

documents.title: hurdlers in hemel hempstead
text: year nine 's at abbot 's hill school in hemel hempstead have been reporting on international stories including the oscars and technology .
they even interviewed an olympic hurdler .
our school reporters are jumping to it

documents.title: tell us what you 're up to
text: here at school report hq , we 'll strive to mention as many of our participating schools as possible between now and 20:00 gmt on this live page - but we need your help !
send us updates and from your buzzing school newsrooms and we 'll do the rest !

documents.title: feeling happy now
text: reporters from greenvale school in catford are feeling happy now .
they have taken part in an uplifting workshop on happiness and even did a survey to find out happy the school is .
a storyteller came in and was very funny - which definitely helped raise happiness levels !

documents.title: more cameras needed at gordano school
text: gordano school in bristol has had a very busy few weeks , from reporting on school plays to finding out whether video games have replaced sport .
but they 've encountered a problem familiar to many reporters - equipment has been scarce .

documents.title: all set for news day !
text: good luck to school reporters at lyndon school , solihull .
enjoy your day !

documents.title: mascot magnus joins melland 's team
text: melland high school in manchester have even got their mascot magnus involved in their news day activities !

documents.title: school reporters busy in new broadcasting house
text: school reporters are hitting the phones at the bbc 's new broadcasting house in london to get updates from around the country .
among those taking part are students from william ellis school and st marylebone school in london .
max , 12 , from william ellis school , said : `` it 's been interesting to see how the reporters work , and to try to get stories ourselves . ''

documents.title: reporters ' deadline in sleaford
text: carre 's grammar school in sleaford have 24 school reporters in action .
their plan for today includes writing stories about health issues and they have given themselves a tight deadline of finishing them by 10:00 gmt .
we hope you got those stories in on time !

documents.title: working hard
text: colne community school and college in essex say they are all set !
`` we are busy working hard to get their news reports done , '' reports head of media , laura weaver .

documents.title: girls ' rugby and the eu
text: amery hill school in alton , are reporting on girls ' rugby , rock challenge , the voice in a million concert , the eu and the impact of technology .
they also promise a revealing article addressed to parents about the truth surrounding their kids ' interest !

documents.title: school reporters live on radio wales'it 's been frantic '
text: on radio wales this morning , school reporters from cowbridge comprehensive near cardiff are co-presenting the show with jason mohammad .
five pupils from year 9 have decided what issues they would like to be discussed on air .
listen out for their reports on smartphone addiction and the launch of a new rugby academy at their school .
school reporters adam and alice have already been on air , explaining their choice of stories and revealing a few nerves .
`` it 's been quite frantic , there was a bit of last-minute decision making , '' said alice .
at 10.35 gmt former wales rugby great martyn williams will be chatting to the school reporters .

documents.title: question time
text: edinburgh academy pupils have been putting their questions to humza yousaf msp , scotland 's minister for europe and international development .
their school report colleagues are off to bbc scotland , pacific quay to take part in its news day event .

documents.title: filming underway at christleton high school
text: news in from christleton high school in chester , where year 8-10 students are taking part in school report .
they are covering to including feminism , music and obesity and currently filming their reports .

documents.title: when can we eat the doughnuts ?
text: update from saint aidan 's church of england high school , lancashire :
the sugar team ca n't wait to finish recording their story so they can eat the doughnuts !

documents.title: from football to flooding
text: breaking news from southam college !
southam college 's reporters are ready and raring to go !
the bbc 's 10th annual news day for school report is underway and students are busy researching their top stories .
from football to flooding , there are no shortage of local sources but the national and political stories are going to take some thinking .
the 2pm deadline is looming and all stories will be published by 4pm !

documents.title: football interview
text: update from market bosworth school , leicestershire :
hi !
we have started reporting and are busy gathering the news .
two of our girls are just going to interview ian stringer , a bbc football reporter , on the rise of leicester city.. go foxes !

documents.title: getting ready to go !
text: school reporters at warwick school are setting up their newsroom .
good luck guys !

documents.title: carrickfergus college northern ireland - miss long 's year 12 class
text: lanyards on !
getting ready for bbc school report day !
top story - fracking in woodburn forest a local yet global story .
hollywood actor mark ruffalo has voiced his support against it !

documents.title: 'mandela was my inspiration ' says mcilroy
text: world number two golfer and four-time major winner rory mcilroy tells school reporters from sullivan upper school in holywood , belfast that roger federer and nelson mandela are two of his role models .

documents.title: listen to jason mohammad live
text: our first live broadcast is under way - click on the live coverage tab to listen to jason mohammad 's bbc radio wales show with bbc school reporters .

documents.title: sporting dreams
text: school reporters from st johns catholic school for the deaf in boston spa , west yorkshire interview professional deaf rugby player mat gilbert .

documents.title: put yourself on the map
text: school report 's interactive map links to all the 1,000 schools taking part in this year 's 10th anniversary project .
have a look during the day to check that your school is on there and to see what the rest of the 30,000 school reporters around the uk are up to .

documents.title: school reporters tackle pollution
text: school reporters from the gandhi memorial public school in dehli find out what can be done to combat pollution in the city .
good work !

documents.title: school report is trending
text: it 's not yet 09:00 gmt and bbc school report is already trending !

documents.title: check and double check !
text: here at the bbc we must be very careful that our stories do n't break any laws - and the same applies to all you budding young journalists .
our keeping it safe and legal resource page will help you stay on track .

documents.title: waking up to sleep
text: how much sleep do teenagers need ?
school reporters from northumberland church of england academy in ashington helped researchers at oxford university to find out .
have a look here to read about it .

documents.title: driving force
text: the enterprising students at the beacon school in chesham set up an interview with f1 legend sir jackie stewart at his home in switzerland .
watch the three-time world champion explain how he overcame his extreme dyslexia and go on to sporting greatness .

documents.title: hamburg 's refugee crisis
text: it 's not just schools in the uk which are taking part on news day 2016 .
a school in hamburg made this lovely report about how the german city is coping with a growing influx of refugees .
nice work !

documents.title: beating the boys !
text: british paralympic sprinter libby clegg tells bbc news school reporters from copthall school in barnet that one of her main motivations for getting into athletics as a child was being able to beat the boys in races .

documents.title: hints and tips
text: need any tips or reminders on how to construct a compelling news story ?
our resource on writing news offers all the help you need .

documents.title: living with blindness
text: recent medical developments mean that some visually impaired people have the chance of having a little of their sight restored .
one school reporter , kelsey , from watford boys grammar school has been exploring one such development , the bionic eye

documents.title: check out our website
text: do n't forget to keep an eye on our news day 2016 index to see what news stories schools around the uk ( and abroad ) are making .

documents.title: digital detox
text: the amazing school reporters at tarporley high school have now finished an epic seven-day digital detox .
have a look at their final video diary to see how they coped - or did n't - without social media for a week .
ever wondered what makes us happy ?
greenvale school reporters set about finding out .
well done guys !

documents.title: a message from our ambassador
text: newsreader huw edwards has been a school report ambassador since the project first started , way back in 2007 .
watch him praise and inspire our 30,000 school reporters on their big day .

documents.title: school report news day is here !
text: a very warm welcome to bbc news school report 's 10th annual news day .

over the next 12 hours we will bring you reports and updates from around the uk as around 30,000 school reporters at more than 1,000 schools all around the uk make their own news for a real audience .
